title: Bug 17825: ControlExampleText beeps when SWT.MULTI is selected
description: ControlExampleText produces a beeping sound when SWT.MULTI is selected, which seems to be unintentional.
OB: When selecting SWT.MULTI, the ControlExampleText produces a beeping sound. Additionally, clicking on other buttons also triggers the beeping sound.
EB: ControlExampleText should not produce a beeping sound when selecting SWT.MULTI. Clicking on other buttons should not trigger any beeping sounds.
SR:
1. Build F1 (20020521) on Win2K
2. Open the SWT example ControlExample
3. Navigate to the Text tab
4. Click on 'Styles' and select 'SWT.SINGLE'
5. Click on 'Styles' again and select 'SWT.MULTI'
